head.title: Update: COVID-19 April 13th - Doniphan R-I School District

meta.content: On Thursday, April 9, Governor Parson ordered all schools closed for the remainder of the 2019-2020 school year. This closure, though necessary, does create difficult decisions as how to end this school year. Here are updates on the following topics.

nav.div: Doniphan R-I School District » News » What's New » Update: COVID-19 April 13th

div.p:
On Thursday, April 9, Governor Parson ordered all schools closed for the remainder of the 2019-2020 school year. This closure, though necessary, does create difficult decisions as how to end this school year. Here are updates on the following topics.
MEALS:
We will continue to distribute meals through May 12, which was our last scheduled school day. Deliveries and pickups will continue on Tuesday’s and Friday’s, through May 12. Pickups will continue to be between 8:00 a.m. -11:00 a.m. and deliveries will be 11:00 a.m. – 1:00 p.m. For those who are picking up meals, please stay in your car. Someone will bring the meals to you. If your meals are being delivered, please limit your contact with the person or persons who are distributing the meals. If possible, we recommend sitting a box or a clothes basket in the drive way for food distribution.
ENRICHMENT/SCHOOL WORK:
We will resume distributing packets on April 21. Packets can be picked up on Tuesday’s and Friday’s (Starting April 21) at the Elementary cafeteria between 8:00 a.m. and 11:00 a.m. We will also continue providing activities online, for those with internet access.

Pre-K: Assignments are uploaded to the class Dojo. Packets available April 21.
Elementary K-2: Activities from each grade level will continue to be uploaded to the Elementary webpage. This webpage can be accessed from the District website. Packets available April 21. If you need copies emailed or have questions about packets, please email your building principal at wjohnson@doniphanr1.k12.mo.us
Intermediate 3-5: Activities from each grade level will continue to be uploaded to the Intermediate webpage. This webpage can be accessed from the District website. Packets available April 21. If you need copies emailed or have questions about packets, please email your building principal at hwillcut@doniphanr1.k12.mo.us
Middle School 6-8: Activities will continue to be distributed through google classroom and email. Packets available April 21. For questions, please email your building principal at jfish@doniphanr1.k12.mo.us
High School 9-12: Activities will be distributed through google classroom and email. Packets available April 21. IMPORTANT: STUDENTS PLEASE CHECK YOUR EMAIL DAILY!!! For questions, please email your building principal at mjones@doniphanr1.k12.mo.us

p.br:
Each building will use 3rd quarter grades as the 2nd semester grade. All students in grades K-8 will be promoted unless you have been contacted by your building principal. High School students in jeopardy of not earning the required credits to be promoted will be contacted by the building principal.
BUILDINGS:
ALL buildings will remain closed to the public and nonessential staff through May 1. This includes ALL building offices and Central Office.
PERSONAL ITEMS:
Beginning May 4, students may return to school to retrieve their personal items. Please return all textbooks and library books when you pick up your personal items. Below is a schedule for each grade level.

ul.li: Parents pick-up items at the Pre-K Building
All items will be bagged and ready for pick-up
Parents pick-up items at the Elementary Office Building
All items will be bagged and ready for pick-up
Parents pick-up items at the Intermediate Office Building
All items will be bagged and ready for pick-up

div.p: Middle School 6-8: Students will be allowed to enter the building to collect items on the following dates/times:
High School 9-12: Students will be allowed to enter the building to collect items on the following dates/times:

p.strong: ALL BUILDINGS will be open until 7:00 p.m. on May 11 for those who cannot pick-up items on one of the scheduled days/times.

p.br:
Graduation, the Honors Assembly, and Prom has not been cancelled at this time. We are still hopeful these events can be scheduled for a later date.
SUMMER SCHOOL:
There has not been a decision about Summer School. We are waiting on information from the Department of Education.
Thank you for your support and cooperation as we continue to make decisions during these unusual circumstances.

div.div:
401 Walnut Street, Doniphan, MO 63935
Phone (573)996-3667 x1700 | Fax (573)996-5865
